H0.text: The particles in a liquid lava sample have a lower temperature compared to the particles in a hardened lava sample.

H1.text: The particles in a liquid lava sample have less kinetic energy compared to the particles in a hardened lava sample.

H2.text: The particles in a liquid lava sample are moving faster compared to the particles in a hardened lava sample.

H3.text: The particles in a liquid lava sample are closer together than the particles in a hardened lava sample.

A4.text: The temperature of most types of molten lava ranges from about 800 째C (1,470 째F) to 1,200 째C (2,190 째F) depending on the lava's chemical composition.

A5.text: Lava is most fluid when first erupted, becoming much more viscous as its temperature drops.
